segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, drying dishes, and it makes me think of my own mother.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems so calm and focused on what she's doing, just like my mom used to be.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, it reminds me of the garden my mom used to tend to.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water overflowing from the sink, pouring onto the floor, but she doesn't seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in a puddle of water, but she doesn't even flinch, just like my mom who was always so focused on her tasks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really tired or just really determined to finish those dishes, just like my mom was.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching for cookies, and the stool looks like it's about to tip over, it reminds me of the times I used to sneak cookies with my siblings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she turns around soon before something bad happens, just like my mom always seemed to know when we were up to no good.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like watching a scene from my own childhood, everything is happening at once.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit anxious just watching this unfold, but I also feel a sense of nostalgia.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like she's in her own little world, and nothing can disturb her peace, just like my mom was.
segments.speaker: PAR
